the pictures for everyone if we need to  do fish pictures you know we're in the  water sometimes and then we just work

exactly the same  we feed the stock ponds whilst whoever's  cooking gets breakfast ready deliver
breakfast then if there's any fish being  caught we have to do some photos  then send photos to the anglers any bait
orders particles stuff like that we'll  take that round as well  spend a bit of time with the anglers  make sure everybody's happy
the most rewarding part of the job for  me you have to be seeing the guest catch  you know especially when you put some
time in with them  the clients are the main one when  they're catching fish i'm a happy man
people catch fish go home happy that  means i'm doing my job properly so  spending time with the anglers is
paramount and i really enjoy it i get to  meet people from all walks of life  from all over europe and i've made some
really good contacts and really close  friends that will be for life  but other sides of it the the stocking
program  i really enjoy that so we spend so two  times a day we go out feeding the stock
ponds so watching them grow it's almost  like they're your babies because they  start off so small and then when they
finally go into the main lake into the  big bad world and then you see them  start getting caught and getting bigger  i really really enjoy that it's just
incredible  um there's a few but definitely when  someone catches a pb to see their smile  on their face
yeah that's why we do it  then lunch time we've got rolls stuff  like that so we'll deliver them spend a
bit more time with everyone and by the  time the afternoon's gone it's dinner  time well for me the best night's got to
be barbecue night you know we invite the  guys over here half an hour early crack  some beers we get some tunes on you know
it's good to hear everybody's report for  the week how everybody's doing obviously  we we barely won one week on one lake
one week on another lake so sometimes we  don't get to interact with all the  guests that are across the road or vice
versa you know so it's brilliant to hear  how everybody's weights going  evening time a little bit of downtime if
we're fishing we're trying to put a bit  of bait out maybe tie some fresh rigs  but we're always on call so 24 hours a
day if there's a bigger that gets caught  we are on the phone we are out with the  waders rain or shine and then in the
evening finish my catch report from the  week before  then sleep  have a bit of sleep
wake up again in the morning hopefully  got a couple of fish for myself but  i'm hoping some real big ones have come

[Music]  it's our last afternoon in gigantico and
i have to say i'm a bit sad i've caught  some amazing fish this session really  got into it run the changes that's
worked and it always feels good when  you're winning  so to talk about the rig in the bag and
the bag mix  the rig has to be short it has to be  braid so it folds up inside the bag you
want three and a half to four inches  from the loop at one end that you loop  to looping on to the bend of the hook at
the other end you can use it  multi-rig style as i've got it here or  you can just tie them up as you go
you can use the knotless knot or the  whipping knot to tie the hook on as long  as the line is coming through the front  of the eye and you've got a kicker or
something on there to help the hook turn  then it will work keep the hook bait  small i'm using just one grain of slow
sinking maize with a with like a wafter  underneath it but just a chop down bit  everything that goes in the bag is small
so you want your hook bait to be small  as well the lead system i've got a  running in line three ounce flat pair in
line um that's the hook leg is attached  to a quick link that's covered up with a  nice sleeve that sort of semi-fixes
inside the inline so when the fish picks  it up it fills the weight instantly and  then the lead is sliding away and
there's no anchor point and then bag mix  wise there are no rules the things you  want to avoid really um is boiling mix
because it goes soft and the bags don't  stay don't stay tight um but small  pellets from two to sort of three or
